DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the participant's sexually transmitted infection (STI) history._Type of sexually transmitted disorder/disease/infection (STD, STI)

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the participant's sexually transmitted infection (STI) history.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder acquired through sexual contact. --2004

Concepts.definition: A disorder acquired through sexual contact.

Property.preferredDefinition: An account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed Conceptual Domain to the RELEASED Version of Assessments in preparation of OneData.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Type of sexually transmitted disorder/disease/infection (STD, STI)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any inflammatory skin disease caused by a herpesvirus and characterized by the formation of small vesicles in clusters.

Concepts.definition: Any inflammatory skin disease caused by a herpesvirus and characterized by the formation of small vesicles in clusters.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A contagious venereal disease caused by the spirochete TREPONEMA PALLIDUM.

Concepts.definition: A contagious bacterial infection caused by the spirochete Treponema pallidum. It is a sexually transmitted disorder, although it can also be transmitted from the mother to the fetus in utero. Typically, it is initially manifested with a single sore which heals without treatment. If the infection is left untreated, the initial stage is followed by skin rash and mucous membrane lesions. A late stage follows, which is characterized by damage of the internal organs, including the nervous system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genus of flagellate protozoa parasitic in birds and mammals, distinguished by the presence of four anterior flagella, an undulating membrane, and a trailing flagellum.

Concepts.definition: A genus of flagellate protozoa parasitic in birds and mammals, distinguished by the presence of four anterior flagella, an undulating membrane, and a trailing flagellum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the urethra secondary to infection with any bacteria other than Neisseria gonorrhoeae.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the urethra secondary to infection with any bacteria other than Neisseria gonorrhoeae.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genus of bacteria within the Chlamydiea phylum that contains only the three species Chlamydia trachomatis, Chlamydia suis, and Chlamydia muridarum.

Concepts.definition: A genus of bacteria within the Chlamydiae phylum that contains only the three species Chlamydia trachomatis, Chlamydia suis, and Chlamydia muridarum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A common sexually transmitted bacterial infection caused by Neisseria gonorrhea. It is transmitted through vaginal, oral, or anal intercourse. Infected individuals may be asymptomatic. Symptoms in males include burning sensation during urination, discharge from the penis, and painful swelling of the testes. Symptoms in females include painful urination, vaginal discharge, and vaginal bleeding between periods. If untreated, the infection may lead to pelvic inflammatory disease.

Concepts.definition: A common sexually transmitted bacterial infection caused by Neisseria gonorrhoeae. It is transmitted through vaginal, oral, or anal intercourse. Infected individuals may be asymptomatic. Symptoms in males include burning sensation during urination, discharge from the penis, and painful swelling of the testes. Symptoms in females include painful urination, vaginal discharge, and vaginal bleeding between periods. If untreated, the infection may lead to pelvic inflammatory disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sexually transmitted papillary growth caused by the human papilloma virus. It usually arises in the skin and mucous membranes of the perianal region and external genitalia.

Concepts.definition: A sexually transmitted papillary growth caused by the human papillomavirus. It usually arises in the skin and mucous membranes of the perianal region and external genitalia.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A disorder acquired through sexual contact.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A disorder acquired through sexual contact.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
